issues.title: Create core data models for Chief of Staff
issues.body:
## Description

Create the foundational data models for the Chief of Staff agent. These models define the structure for goals, decisions, work logs, standups, daily summaries, and autopilot sessions.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `GoalStatus` enum with values: PENDING, IN_PROGRESS, DONE, PARTIAL, SKIPPED, BLOCKED
- [ ] `CheckpointTrigger` enum with all trigger types
- [ ] `DailyGoal` dataclass with all fields and `to_dict`/`from_dict` methods
- [ ] `Decision` dataclass with serialization methods
- [ ] `WorkLogEntry` dataclass with serialization methods
- [ ] `StandupSession` dataclass with nested serialization
- [ ] `DailySummary` dataclass with carryover goals support
- [ ] `DailyLog` dataclass with timestamp auto-initialization
- [ ] All state snapshot models: `GitState`, `FeatureSummary`, `BugSummary`, `PRDSummary`, `SpecSummary`, `TestState`, `GitHubState`, `InterruptedSession`, `RepoStateSnapshot`
- [ ] Recommendation models: `Recommendation`, `AttentionItem`, `StandupReport`
- [ ] Autopilot models: `CheckpointEvent`, `AutopilotSession`
- [ ] Unit tests covering serialization round-trips for all models

## Technical Notes

- File: `swarm_attack/chief_of_staff/models.py`
- Use `dataclasses` with `field(default_factory=...)` for mutable defaults
- All enums should use string values for JSON compatibility
- Ensure `from_dict` handles enum conversion properly
- Follow existing patterns in `swarm_attack/models/` for serialization

## Interface Contract (REQUIRED)

**Pattern Reference:** See `swarm_attack/models/feature.py` for dataclass patterns.

**Required Methods for all dataclasses:**
- `to_dict(self) -> dict[str, Any]` - Instance method to serialize
- `from_dict(cls, data: dict[str, Any]) -> ClassName` - Classmethod to deserialize

issues.title: Implement DailyLogManager for persistence
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the DailyLogManager class that handles reading and writing daily logs in both markdown and JSON formats, plus the append-only decision JSONL log.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `DailyLogManager.__init__(base_path: Path)` initializes storage path
- [ ] `get_log(date: date) -> Optional[DailyLog]` retrieves log for specific date
- [ ] `get_today() -> DailyLog` gets or creates today's log
- [ ] `get_yesterday() -> Optional[DailyLog]` retrieves yesterday's log
- [ ] `save_log(log: DailyLog)` saves to both .md and .json atomically
- [ ] `add_standup(standup: StandupSession)` adds standup to today's log
- [ ] `add_work_entry(entry: WorkLogEntry)` adds work entry to today's log
- [ ] `set_summary(summary: DailySummary)` sets end-of-day summary
- [ ] `append_decision(decision: Decision)` appends to decisions.jsonl
- [ ] `get_decisions(since, decision_type)` queries decisions from JSONL
- [ ] `get_history(days: int)` returns logs for last N days
- [ ] `generate_weekly_summary(week, year)` generates markdown summary
- [ ] Atomic file writes with temp file + rename pattern
- [ ] Unit tests for all CRUD operations
- [ ] Tests for edge cases: first run, corrupted files

## Technical Notes

- File: `swarm_attack/chief_of_staff/daily_log.py`
- Storage path: `.swarm/chief-of-staff/daily-log/`
- Daily logs: `YYYY-MM-DD.md` and `YYYY-MM-DD.json`
- Decisions: `decisions.jsonl` (one JSON object per line)
- Use `_save_atomic()` pattern from existing code
- Markdown format should match spec section 10.3

issues.title: Implement StateGatherer for repository state
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the StateGatherer class that aggregates state from all repository data sources: git, features, bugs, PRDs, specs, tests, GitHub, and interrupted sessions.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `StateGatherer.__init__(config: SwarmConfig)` initializes with configuration
- [ ] `gather(include_github: bool) -> RepoStateSnapshot` returns complete snapshot
- [ ] `gather_git_state() -> GitState` gathers branch, status, commits, ahead/behind
- [ ] `gather_features() -> list[FeatureSummary]` reads from .swarm/state/*.json
- [ ] `gather_bugs() -> list[BugSummary]` reads from .swarm/bugs/*/state.json
- [ ] `gather_prds() -> list[PRDSummary]` reads from .claude/prds/*.md with frontmatter
- [ ] `gather_specs() -> list[SpecSummary]` reads from specs/*/ with review status
- [ ] `gather_tests() -> TestState` runs pytest --collect-only for test counts
- [ ] `gather_github() -> Optional[GitHubState]` queries via gh CLI
- [ ] `gather_interrupted_sessions() -> list[InterruptedSession]` finds interrupted sessions
- [ ] `calculate_costs() -> tuple[float, float]` returns today and weekly costs
- [ ] Graceful degradation when GitHub unavailable
- [ ] Unit tests with mocked data sources

## Technical Notes

- File: `swarm_attack/chief_of_staff/state_gatherer.py`
- Use subprocess for git and gh CLI commands
- Parse pytest output for test counts
- Handle missing directories/files gracefully
- Consider async execution for parallel gathering (optional optimization)

issues.title: Implement GoalTracker for goal management
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the GoalTracker class that manages daily goals, tracks completion status, and reconciles goal status with actual repository state.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `GoalTracker.__init__(daily_log_manager: DailyLogManager)` initializes with log manager
- [ ] `get_today_goals() -> list[DailyGoal]` returns current goals for today
- [ ] `set_goals(goals: list[DailyGoal])` sets goals for today
- [ ] `update_goal(goal_id, status, notes)` updates a goal's status
- [ ] `mark_complete(goal_id, actual_minutes)` marks goal as complete with timing
- [ ] `get_yesterday_goals() -> list[DailyGoal]` returns yesterday's goals
- [ ] `compare_plan_vs_actual() -> dict` compares yesterday's plan vs results
- [ ] `get_carryover_goals() -> list[DailyGoal]` returns incomplete goals to carry over
- [ ] `reconcile_with_state(snapshot) -> list[dict]` reconciles goals with repo state
- [ ] `generate_recommendations(state) -> list[Recommendation]` generates prioritized recommendations
- [ ] Reconciliation handles linked_feature, linked_bug, linked_spec
- [ ] Recommendations follow priority rules from spec (P1 blockers/approvals, P2 in-progress, P3 new)
- [ ] Unit tests for goal operations and reconciliation logic

## Technical Notes

- File: `swarm_attack/chief_of_staff/goal_tracker.py`
- Reconciliation maps: feature phase -> goal status, bug phase -> goal status
- Recommendation algorithm should match spec section 13.7
- Goals are persisted through DailyLogManager

issues.title: Implement CheckpointSystem for autopilot triggers
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the CheckpointSystem class that detects when autopilot should pause for human intervention based on cost, time, errors, approvals, and risk factors.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `CheckpointSystem.__init__(config: ChiefOfStaffConfig)` initializes with config
- [ ] `check_triggers(session, current_action) -> Optional[CheckpointTrigger]` checks all triggers
- [ ] `matches_stop_trigger(session, trigger) -> bool` checks --until trigger matching
- [ ] `is_high_risk(action: str) -> bool` identifies high-risk actions
- [ ] `record_error()` tracks consecutive errors
- [ ] `reset_error_count()` resets error streak after success
- [ ] `should_pause_for_approval(action) -> bool` checks if action needs approval
- [ ] Triggers checked in order: stop_trigger, cost, time, approval, high_risk, errors, blocker
- [ ] High-risk actions: architectural changes, main branch push, destructive operations
- [ ] Unit tests for each trigger type and edge cases

## Technical Notes

- File: `swarm_attack/chief_of_staff/checkpoints.py`
- Use config thresholds: budget_usd, duration_minutes, error_streak
- Pattern match action strings for risk/approval detection
- Return first matching trigger (order matters)

issues.title: Implement AutopilotRunner for autonomous execution
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the AutopilotRunner class that executes goals autonomously with checkpoint enforcement, budget/time limits, and pause/resume capability.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `AutopilotRunner.__init__(config, checkpoint_system, goal_tracker, session_store, orchestrator, bug_orchestrator)` initializes all dependencies
- [ ] `start(goals, budget_usd, duration_seconds, stop_trigger) -> AutopilotSession` starts new session
- [ ] `resume(session_id: str) -> AutopilotSession` resumes paused session from stored state
- [ ] `execute_goal(goal: DailyGoal) -> tuple[bool, float]` executes single goal
- [ ] `handle_checkpoint(session, trigger) -> str` returns 'continue', 'pause', or 'abort'
- [ ] `get_status(session_id) -> Optional[AutopilotSession]` returns session status
- [ ] `_persist_session(session)` saves state for pause/resume
- [ ] Session persisted before every checkpoint
- [ ] Goals executed in order with index tracking
- [ ] Cost and duration tracked and checked against limits
- [ ] --until trigger support via stop_trigger parameter
- [ ] Integration with Orchestrator for feature goals
- [ ] Integration with BugOrchestrator for bug goals
- [ ] Unit tests for execution flow, checkpoints, pause/resume

## Technical Notes

- File: `swarm_attack/chief_of_staff/autopilot.py`
- Resume implementation per spec section 13.5
- Execute goals by calling appropriate orchestrator based on linked_feature/linked_bug
- Handle goals without links (manual/custom goals) gracefully
- Generate unique session_id like 'ap-YYYYMMDD-NNN'
